alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 1:25PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 315 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 124 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain has ended, however, flooding remains a threat while waters recede. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Carrizo Creek, Decker Wash, Hess Wash, Pierce Wash, Phoenix Park Wash and Black Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Apache Reservation. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 307 and 312. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
